intro: Anthericum baeticum var. rhiphaeum, commonly known as the Baetican nettle, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence composed of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It features heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
